summary:
Do you want your mod order applied to all or some of your other profiles while keeping only the profile specific mods activated?
Or would you rather have your mods sorted like your plugin loadorder ?
Then look no further! MOO does just that.
descriptionHtml:
[center]

[img]http://imgur.com/cIEzdyP.png[/img][/center]


[center][size=3]Are you tired of dragging and dropping your mods in Mod Organizer's left pane manually for every single profile of yours?[/size]
[size=3]Would you rather just do it once and have your mod order applied to all or some of your other profiles while [/size]
[size=3]keeping only the profile specific mods activated?[/size]
[size=4]Or would you rather have your mods sorted like your plugin loadorder ?[/size]
[size=3]Then look no further! [/size]
[size=3]Mod Order Organizer is a small tool that does just that.[/size][/center]


[size=3][color=#ff0000]IMPORTANT[/color]: You must have opened each profile in Mod Organizer at least once since you last installed a new mod so the profile's modlist.txt gets updated.[/size]


[center][size=6][u]Sorting like your plugin loadorder.[/u][/size][/center]

Current shortcommings:
[list][*][size=2]Texture mods etc. have so be sorted manually (kind of obvious but I'll thought I'll add it here)[/size]
[*][size=2]If you have multiple mods with the same plugin (like profile specific bashed patches), only one of them will be in the correct position[/size]
[*][size=2]Mods in your overwrite folder will break the sorting[/size]
[/list]

[center][img]http://imgur.com/1ESA8nR.png[/img][/center]





[center][size=6][u]Sorting like another modlist.[/u][/size]
[img]http://imgur.com/T1imAbn.png[/img][/center]




[size=3]Why did I make this?[/size]
Because I would rather spend 4 (update: like 10 :| ) days learning the basics of Python than have messy Mod Organizer profiles.



[size=3]Credits:[/size]
The users of stackoverflow.com for all the help and code they provide for people in need.
Â
author: pivotiiii

files.name: Mod Order Organizer
files.changelogHtml:
last selected master profile will be remembered now
fixed case sensitivity during check for correct profiles directory

files.name: Mod Order Organizer 2.0
files.changelogHtml:
added the function to sort your modlist like your loadorder (!!!)
variables get saved to registry instead of a .txt file now
improved debug clean up
